newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek stocks close up, extend winning streak.
newsitem.headline: Greek stocks close up, extend winning streak.

text.p: Greek equities continued their bull run extending their winning streak to six consecutive gainful sessions despite some intraday profit taking in heavy volume.
Brokers said sentiment was bullish on expectations that snap polls will bring about a strong government that will steer the economy harder towards its EMU goal.

"The market is clearly discounting Simitis' victory in the upcoming elections which will mark the end of a prolonged period of political uncertainty," said Telesis Securities in its weekly market outlook.

"The stock market will consolidate its gains this week. We expect overall sentiment to remain positive throughout the short pre-election period in anticipation of a stable and market friendly government," it said.
But additional liquidity was seen necessary for the rally to continue.

The Athens general share index finished 0.82 percent, or 7.73 points higher at 948.58 from Friday's 940.85 close after opening at 941.47 points. Turnover dropped to 9.84 from 12.2 billion drachmas on Friday, on volume of 4.8 million shares.
Greek President Costis Stephanopoulos signed a decree on Friday ordering the dissolution of the 300-seat parliament ahead of early elections on September 22.

Gainers led losers 151 to 71 with 22 issues unchanged on 244 traded. Banks gained 1.13 percent, industrials ended 0.52 percent higher with construction rising 3.92 percent. Small-caps ended flat at 82.06 on the parallel market index.

The Merrill Lynch call spread warrant on OTE with a strike price of 3,800 drachmas was quoted at 585-603 at the close. Shares of OTE telecom OTEr.AT, the underlying, ended softer, down 10 drachmas at 4,075 on heavy volume.

The recently launched Merrill Lynch stock index call warrant based on a basket of 23 shares was quoted at 222.80-234.50 drachmas. It expires on January 9 1998 with a strike price of 1000. It was in the money at 1038.3.
The Morgan Stanley Hellenic Blue Chip Warrant, which has a strike price of 100 marks, was quoted higher at 3,896-4,145 drachmas at the close. --George Georgiopoulos, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
